Review.Titre: Wrong voucher numbers - bad customer service
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer for several years and always choose to buy vouchers from this website. Things were smooth throughout the years, until today. I purchased two vouchers which did not work, and received and error which said the voucher numbers were wrong. Me, being the loyal customer who thinks that MobileRecharge cares about their customers, emailed them explaining the situation. They go on to say that they contacted the telecom company and they said I had recharged them. I sent them screenshots of the error to prove I did not, but that didn’t seem to phase them. Long story short, they only care about taking your money, and if things go south, you’re on your own. Use at your own risk.

Review.Titre: I had an absolutely dreadful experience…
Review.Contenu: I had an absolutely dreadful experience with this mobile recharge service. I ordered $35 NZD with the promise that the recipient would receive 1529.46 AFN(after tax), but what actually happened was far from what was advertised.The beneficiary only received 1257.00 AFN once the transaction was completed, which is a sizable difference from the amount that was promised. Because I was obviously mislead and the service provider did not fulfill their promise, I was rather upset with this service.I contacted their customer service to report this, hoping for a solution or, at minimum, a reimbursement for the difference. To my dismay, no effort was taken to address the matter and my complaint was treated with apathy.I would strongly urge people not to use this mobile recharge service because it is untrustworthy and unreliable. I regret ever using their service because of this frustrating and expensive experience. Save yourself the trouble and look elsewhere for a more honest and reputable provider.I have photo evidence from the receiver that they only received 1257.00 AFN

Review.Titre: I supect MobileRecharge is a scam...
Review.Contenu: I supect MobileRecharge is a scam...I'm an Italian resident and did two recharge attempts today towards a Lycamobile US number.1. the first attempt, I used my PayPal account with my AmEx card (which I use almost every day for eBay, e-commerce, etc.), anyway my order n. 26208475 has been cancelled (why?) 8 hours after purchase (and successful payment/debit on my credit card). Since I received a cancellation email with terms for refund, I still hope that I'll finally get such a refund sooner or later (even if I still don't get why my valid PayPal account and AmEx active and working card didn't work for them...); let me add also that I called them twice, since they needed verification on my side, which I did. I called and responded to their questions related with my personal data.2. after this initial failure (through PayPal and even though I gave all the required answers), I retried with my credit card directly (no PayPal this time) but this time, after correct verification with American Express and being debited the second time, I even didn't get any order number! In my history now, there's no orders at all!!! So I've been forced to call them (the third time) to ask for clarification and was told by Mr. Santiago that this second order was cancelled too! But after my order on the website there's still no trace neither of the previous nor of the second order! I then received a cancellation email from the customer service stating that I'll receive a refund in 2 working days, which I do hope so... Anyway my credit card now appears saved in my account (as it should be for *successful* orders!), so I decided to cancel it to protect my security.I had a very bad experience with MobileRecharge, a waste of time and money (three phone calls to UK and US) with no result (and with no apparent reason from their side).Moreover I have still the problem to top up my Lycamobile US number for my daughter which is a big issue for me.Be careful if you really want/need to do business with them, little traceability, no receipt, ne response to written customer support contacts, no log/history of past orders (with their status). Very unprofessional and risky.

Review.Titre: Who are the customers of this app?
Review.Contenu: Who are the customers of this app? I believe, people who are travelling a lot. Suppose to be so... And what happens when u r arriving to new, unfamiliar country, where u r restricted in using ethernet, cellphone etc due to the rouming and u need to refill yr new sim? U find wi-fy, install mobile recharge, create account, add yr debit/credit card, pay - yr bank confirms transaction an signs off money to refill yr sim and u r happy but no! Mobile recharge needs 3d security varification. It is not enought that yr bank approve this transaction. They have their own security measures. Ok. U spent hours or day with bad wi-fy in unknown country to go to bank website, set 3d security, talking to ur bank by phone... Done. U try to refill again but no... U can not do anything because previous transaction still in progress... U create new account, repeat all again, all is ok, but no... U have a mail with request to contact mobile recharge team to confirm yr account. How can u do it in rouming? Don't warry, they can call u, believing, that incaming calls are free for u... U spent 5$ for conversation with them and confirm yr account. 1 day and 5$ lost to refill yr new sim for 10$. May be it is too much?

Review.Titre: Not Really Happy!!!
Review.Contenu: God _DayI use your service as well as another. I must say that your service at times more than not seems to have a delay in sending airtime. I have on several occasions to numbers I previously sent via your service remain in a pending status for hours.  Which frankly is counter to what is required which is to get airtime on a phone.I know one can assume perhaps its the cell phone provider.  However, on several occasions while your service is still in a pending status I, use my other airtime recharge service, and airtime which arrives almost instantly.  SO its not the cell phone provider causing the delay.Additionally, when a transaction does fail after remaining in a pending status there is no feed-back. The transaction just goes from "pending" to no record. Its like the transaction was never tried. Thus; your system only show successful transactions. Yet my PayPal will show a transaction pending charge for your failed transaction.  For the record ALL that I have described just occurred today 3 Dec 2017.To be honest I only continue to try your service because you allow a larger amount to be sent while the other and more reliable service has smaller limits thus more transactions is required. Yup! that's my experience.

I try to be very careful to turn off my data when I have wifi and to only turn it on when I need it. Unfortunately, I still run out quickly and never really understood how many Gigabytes I need.  While adding GB has been easy with  Mobile Recharge, the experience of running out of data has been confusing and frustrating.

It was too late to help me out in a pickle (I am in a hotel room with a sprained ankle, so it was annoying that this didn't work when I really needed my phone -- I had to limp to the nearest credit charging machine to refill my SIM), but I appreciate that they followed up and fixed the problem fairly promptly.  I probably won't use this service again in this country (Kazakhstan), but I appreciate that there could have been some technical glitch beyond their control.
